content: Your screenshot shows a Write window for composing a reply. So you didn't simply open the message for reading, but clicked Reply for composing a reply to the sender.
creator: christ1

content:
NO. That product has not worked for several years. Simple steps for a full backup are these:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
creator: davidsk

content: A comment: It is in a new beta, but it is not supported here. It may or may not work in the new beta, but even the developer advises caution. If you use it, I suggest extensive testing before placing trust in it. https://mozbackup.jasnapaka.com/support.php
creator: davidsk

content: How are messages entering the other folders? I presume they come in to inbox and are then moved? Capturing all incoming and outgoing is doable, but I don't understand the concern for other folders and how they are updated. Please explain.
creator: davidsk

content: Hello David. Many thanks for your help. It's really not unusual. Picture how any standard webmail account (yahoo, gmail, etc.) works: Messages are moved from the inbox to other folders. Additionally, sent mail is stored in the SENT folder.
creator: welcome
